title: Mythology
subject: Supplemental Standards for English Language Arts (2021-)

document.title: Utah Secondary Supplemental Standards for English Language Arts

31F990C96A9B480FBA2540F0C431E1B3.description:
Evaluate the influences and significance of classical and global myths,
legends, and folklore on modern media and culture, including themes,
motifs, and archetypes.

9EB095E598814A848788D16240DF4897.description:
Analyze how myths, legends, and folklore reflect, influence, and shape the
values of cultures and societies.

738AC7CF467F4BEEAADC8D8D729AAEB2.description:
Describe how myths, legends, and folklore portray different versions of
historical events, figures, and peoples.

797E9E2B665F4DA1B59F5F4997698745.description:
Context, Influence, and Significance. Students will investigate the historicity, influence,
 and significance of classical, world, and indigenous myths, legends, and folklore on
 modern cultures and societies.

ECE64A854EE84C90BAC67A5AEFD5E4C8.description:
Derive meanings about the relationships of “the divine,” “the human,” and “the
physical” in regard to “the cosmos” using storytelling as a vehicle to moralize
themes such as force, violence, hubris, agency, fate, love, and knowledge.

EF16F45A7F3F44778705610396F9703E.description:
Describe the complexities of the relationships and interactions between the
characters and/or deities across and within different mythological and cultural
systems.

129028D51E384CC6AF158F591887A732.description:
Identify archetypal characters and/or deities within myths and the roles they
play across different cultures.

196965D597554ED582223BA4F0910EEF.description:
Relationships and Hierarchies of Characters and Deities. Students will develop an
 understanding of the relationships and hierarchies of characters and deities within myths,
 legends, and folklore.

44FBEA0EC0C4473BBC450F8E18AACD66.description:
Analyze the relevance and influence of myths, legends, and folklore on
literature, art, and societal values within their respective cultures.

CAE18E5206B6404496A82FCBE2D0341B.description:
Evaluate the significance of recurring themes, motifs, structures, and
patterns in myths, legends, and folklore.

F979CD5DB7004F2DB6849536FC982177.description:
Analyze the characteristics and purposes of different types of myths,
legends, and folklore from a variety of cultures.

D2DED4F9987B4ABDAE326DB65DBF5F39.description:
Analysis of Genre. Students will develop an understanding of the genre of classical,
 world, and indigenous myths, legends, and folklore
